drupalNodeEvent.title: Sanctions and Human Rights: Lessons from Hong Kong

field_organizers.processed: U.S.-Asia Law Institute, New York University School of Law

field_description.processed: Beijing's crackdown in Hong Kong in the name of national security has drawn condemnation and sanctions from around the world, including from the US government. But instead of helping to preserve Hong Kongâ€™s freedoms, these measures may have unintentionally helped to accelerate Hong Kong's economic and political integration with mainland China. Professor Carole J. Petersen will talk about the need for self-reflection in light of events in Hong Kong, and why we need a new approach to promote international law and human rights.
